Title: Ivanhoe
Notes: Prohibited by Nazi Germany for featuring Jewish characters.

Title: Oliver Twist
Notes: Prohibited by Nazi Germany for featuring Jewish characters.

Title: The Communist Manifesto
Notes: Prohibited by several countries, Nazi Germany.

Title: Works
Notes: All of Zweig's books published up to 1933 were banned by the Nazis in that same year.

Title: Works
Notes: All of Freud's books published up to 1933 were banned by the Nazis in that same year.

Title: The Jungle (1906)
Notes: In 1956, it was banned in East Germany for its incompatibility with Communism.

Title: The Iron Heel
Notes: Banned by the Nazis along with two other London novels, Martin Eden and The Jacket.

Title: Works
Notes: All of Brecht's books published up to 1933 were banned by the Nazis in that same year.

Title: The Outline of History
Notes: Wells' book was banned in Nazi Germany.

Title: Berlin Garden of Erotic Delights
Author(s): Erwin von Busse under the pseudonym "Granand"
Notes: Banned for "indecency" by courts in Berlin and Leipzig

Title: Mein Kampf (1925)
Notes: In Germany, the copyright of the book was held by the State Government of Bavaria, and the Bavarian authorities prevented any reprinting from 1945 onward. This did not affect existing copies, which were available as vintage books. In 2016, following the expiration of the copyright, Mein Kampf was republished in Germany for the first time since 1945 as a commented edition by the Institut für Zeitgeschichte.

Title: The World of William Clissold
Notes: Banned in Nazi Germany in 1936. A further note to the banning order added that "all other works by the author" were to be suppressed.

Title: All Quiet on the Western Front
Notes: Banned in Nazi Germany for being demoralizing and insulting to the Wehrmacht.

Title: Truth for Germany—The Question of Guilt for the Second World War
Notes: In 1979 this book was listed by Germany's Federal Department for Media Harmful to Young Persons as material that could not be publicly advertised or given to young readers, due to the version it presented of the events that led to World War II. This restriction was lifted in 1994, after a long legal battle.
